titlestmt.titleproper: Onondaga County Community College Presidents' Collection
titlestmt.author: CEC

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user nsyoc.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Presidents' Office Collection

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to researchers without restriction.

bioghist.p: This collection encompasses letters, memos, and documents from the Office of the President of Onondaga Community College.

controlaccess.corpname: Mayorâ€™s Commission for Youth, Inc. (Syracuse, N.Y.)
controlaccess.subject: College administrators
Campus planning
Association of American Colleges and Universities

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of archival material of the people who have served as President of Onondaga Community College, from the founding of the College to the present day. The collection contains memorandums, letters, documents, etc.

userestrict.p: Written permission from the Onondaga Community College Archives and all copyright holders must be obtained before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any material in this collection.

did.unittitle: Office of Dr. Francis Almstead (February 1962 - December 1967)
did.abstract:
Archival material related to the Presidency of Dr. Francis Almstead. Almstead was the first President of Onondaga Community College. He was President from February 1962 to December 1965. Almstead obtained a B.S. and M.S. from St. Lawrence University. Previous positions before becoming OCC President include: science teacher Coeymans, Clinton and Bellmore (all NY) High Schools; NYS Education Dept. Supervisor of Secondary Education; U.S. Navy 1942 to 1946; U.S. Office of Education 1946; SUNY Executive Dean for Institutes and Community Colleges, developed statewide ETV network for NYS Education Dept. After OCC, Mr. Almstead became Director of Technical Services and Research at St. Lawrence University 1966 to 1981. He died December 13, 1985, in Schenectady, NY.
The Collection contains memos and correspondence relating to Almstead's time as President of Onondaga Community College.

did.unittitle: Memorandum and Minutes - Board of Trustees and Committees
did.abstract: Typed memos to members of the Board of Trustees and various Committees.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Faulkner on Academic Standards
did.abstract: One paragraph, typed memo to Mr. Faulkner regarding on academic standards for evaluating students.

did.unittitle: Memo to Glenn Williams on Library
did.abstract: One paragraph, typed memo regarding the need for a library for the College.

did.unittitle: Memo to Ransom McKenzie on Items for Board Meeting
did.abstract: 2 paged, typed memo to Ransom McKenzie regarding items for a Board Meeting. Notes that 905 students have made a deposit for enrollment. Mentions four attachments but attachments are not included.

did.unittitle: Minutes of Board of Trustees
Correspondence with Other Colleges
did.abstract: Correspondence to other Community Colleges.

did.unittitle: Memo from Jane B. Donegan on visit to Broome Technical Community College
did.abstract: Typed 2 page memo from Jane B. Donegan to President Almstead regarding a visit in October, 1962 to Broome Technical Community College. Information was gathered from Lloyd W. Hartmann, Chairman of the Division of General Studies, and Jane Foley, Chief Librarian.

did.unittitle: Letter to Cecil Tyrrel, President of Broome Technical Community College regarding Need for Chemistry Instructor
did.abstract: Typed letter to Cecil C. Tyrrel, President of Broome Technical Community College, asking if he knows anyone who would be willing to be a chemistry technician at OCC for a modest salary.

did.unittitle: Letter to William L. Perry, President of Corning Community College regarding Basketball Season
did.abstract: Typed letter to William L. Perry, President of Corning Community College, inquiring if the Corning Community College Men's Basketball team would be able to play home and home against OCC for the upcoming season. Paul N. Seymour mentioned as coach of the OCC Men's Basketball team.

did.unittitle: Letter to William L. Perry, President of Corning Community College regarding President's Workshop
did.abstract: Typed letter to William Perry, President of Corning Community College regarding a "President's Workshop." Asks Perry for comments and suggestions regarding the topic they are both working on, related to professional staff.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. James F. Hall, President of Dutchess Community College regarding Invitation
did.abstract: Typed letter to Dr. James F. Hall, President of Dutchess Community College, declining to attend a reception for William B. Connor.

did.unittitle: Letter from Robert McKinney, Executive Dean of Dutchess Community College, to President Almstead regarding Teacher Load Profile Forms
did.abstract: Typed letter from Robert McKinney, Executive Dean of Dutchess Community College, regarding the completion of Teacher Load Profile forms.

did.unittitle: Letter from Robert McKinney, Executive Dean of Dutchess Community College regarding Questionnaire on Courses and Programs
did.abstract: Typed letter from Robert McKinney, Executive Dean of Dutchess Community College asking Almstead to complete a questionnaire regarding programs and courses offered at OCC.

did.unittitle: Letter from Laurence E. Spring, President of Erie County Technical Institute Regarding Librarian
did.abstract: Typed letter from Laurence E. Spring, President of Erie County Technical Institute inquiring if there was an open position for a Head Librarian at OCC. A Librarian, Janice Gallinger, at Erie County Technical has expressed interest in a Head Librarian position.

did.unittitle: Letter to Laurence E. Spring, President of Erie County Technical Institute, regarding Head Librarian Position
did.abstract: Typed letter in response to Spring's letter about Janice Gallinger, a librarian interested in the Head Librarian position at OCC. Almstead responds that he had already had another candidate in mind for the position.

did.unittitle: Letter to Laurence E. Spring, President of Erie County Technical Institute regarding Basketball Schedule
did.abstract: Typed letter to Laurence E. Spring inquiring if the Erie County Technical Institute Men's Basketball team could arrange a home and home series with the newly formed OCC Men's Basketball team.

did.unittitle: Letter to Laurence Spring, President of Erie County Technical Institute regarding Jim Shenton
did.abstract: Typed letter, with handwriting, to Laurence Spring, President of Erie County Technical Institute, asking for the availability of Jim Shenton to serve as a consultant.

did.unittitle: Letter from Ernest Notar, Dean of Erie County Technical Institute, regarding George Bidwell
did.abstract: Typed Letter from Ernest Notar, Dean of Erie County Technical Institute, asking Almstead if George Bidwell was a good candidate to operate Erie County Technical Institute's closed circuit TV.

did.unittitle: Letter to Ernest Notar, Dean of Erie County Technical Institute, regarding George Bidwell
did.abstract: Typed Letter to Ernest Notar, Dean of Erie County Technical Institute, affirming that George Bidwell is a good candidate for operating closed circuit television.

did.unittitle: Letter from Ernest Notar, Dean of Erie County Technical Institute regarding Help in Starting New College
did.abstract: Typed letter from Ernest Notar, Dean of Erie County Technical Institute, stating he has accepted a position as President of the newly formed Niagara County Community College. Asks for literature, application forms, brochures, etc. that Almstead used in forming OCC.

did.unittitle: Letter to Ernest Notar regarding appointment as Niagara County Community College President
did.abstract: Typed letter to Ernest Notar congratulating him on his appointment to President of Niagara County Community College.

did.unittitle: Letter from James Shenton regarding contract with Faculty Student Association
did.abstract: Typed letter, with handwriting, from Jim Shenton, Acting President of Erie County Technical Institute, asking for a copy of OCC's contract with the Faculty Student Association.

did.unittitle: Letter to James Shenton in response to contract question
did.abstract: Typed letter informing James Shenton, Acting President of Erie County Technical Institute, that the Board of Trustees does not have a contract with the Faculty-Student Association.

did.unittitle: Letter from Norman H. Foote, Chairman, Division of Agriculture & Ornamental Horticulture at Agricultural and Technical Institute at Farmingdale, regarding Appointment at OCC
did.abstract: Typed letter from Norman H. Foote, Chairman, Division of Agriculture & Ornamental Horticulture at Agricultural and Technical Institute at Farmingdale, congratulating Almstead on becoming President of OCC.

did.unittitle: Letter to Norman H. Foote in response to Congratulation Letter
did.abstract: Typed letter to Norman H. Foote, thanking him for sending a letter congratulating him on his appointment as President of OCC.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dean B. Frank Fuller Jr., Fashion Institute of Technology regarding By-laws
did.abstract: Typed letter to Dean B. Frank Fuller Jr., Fashion Institute of Technology, asking for a copy of the Fashion Institute of Technology's by-laws for help in drafting a set of by-laws at OCC.

did.unittitle: Invitation and Declination to Harpur College (Binghamton University) Commencement
did.abstract: Invitation to Harpur College (now Harpur College of Arts and Sciences at Binghamton University) Commencement Exercises, along with typed response from Almstead, declaring he was unable to attend.

did.unittitle: Letter from Nicholas Alexander, Dean of Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary, regarding invitation to Commencement
did.abstract: Typed letter from Nicholas Alexander, Dean of Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary in Jordanville, NY, inviting Almstead and his wife to Holy Trinity's Commencement.

did.unittitle: Letter to Nicholas Alexander, Dean of Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary, declining invitation to Commencement
did.abstract: Typed letter to Nicholas Alexander, Dean of Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary, declining invitation to Holy Trinity's Commencement due to it being on the same day as OCC's Commencement.

did.unittitle: Letter to Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, regarding Meeting in Syracuse
did.abstract: Typed letter to Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, confirming date for a meeting at Midtown Plaza.

did.unittitle: Letter from Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, regarding meeting in Syracuse
did.abstract: Typed letter from Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, confirming he will attend meeting in Syracuse.

did.unittitle: Letter to Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, regarding filling Chemistry Technician Position
did.abstract: Typed letter to Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, inquiring if Guenther knew of anyone interested in working as an assistant instructor in Chemistry at OCC.

did.unittitle: Letter from Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, regarding Chemistry Technician Position at OCC
did.abstract: Typed letter from Letter from Otto V. Guenther, President of Hudson Valley Community College, informing Almstead that he would keep the position in mind when the current senior class graduates.

did.unittitle: Letter from Francis J. Kramer, Hudson Valley Community College, regarding Faculty Personnel Policy Handbook
did.abstract: Typed letter from Francis J. Kramer, Chairman of the Handbook Revision Committee at Hudson Valley Community College, asking for a copy of OCC's faculty personnel policy handbook.

did.unittitle: Letter to Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding basketball schedule
did.abstract: Typed letter to Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding scheduling a home and home game schedule with the newly formed OCC Men's Basketball team.

did.unittitle: Letter from E.T. Stapleford, Assistant Professor at Jamestown Community College, regarding Salary Increments
did.abstract: Letter from E.T. Stapleford, Assistant Professor of Mathematics at Jamestown Community College, asking how OCC determines salary increments for faculty members.

did.unittitle: Letter to E.T. Stapleford, Assistant Professor at Jamestown Community College regarding Salary Increment Question
did.abstract: Typed letter to E.T. Stapleford, Assistant Professor at Jamestown Community College replying to Stapleford's letter about salary policies.

did.unittitle: Letter from Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding Public Relations Materials
did.abstract: Typed letter from Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, asking Almstead to send a packet of OCC's public relations materials for a display.

did.unittitle: Letter to Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding Public Relations Materials
did.abstract: Typed letter to Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, thanking hom for the reminder about sending public relations materials.

did.unittitle: Letter from Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College regarding California Junior College Film
did.abstract: Typed letter from Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College about a film he received about junior colleges produced by the State of California.

did.unittitle: Letter from Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding Egman Studios
did.abstract: Typed letter from Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding Egman Studios.

did.unittitle: Letter to Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, regarding visit to OCC
did.abstract: Typed letter to Albert W. Baisler, President of Jamestown Community College, thanking him for his suggestions for improving OCC during his visit to the College.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. James E. McVean, President of Jefferson Community College, regarding Jefferson Community College Inaguration
did.abstract: Typed letter to Dr. James E. McVean congratulating him on Jefferson Community College's Inauguration exercises.

did.unittitle: Letter to Arnold Shapiro, President of Board of Trustees of Jefferson Community College, regarding Inauguration
did.abstract: Typed letter to Arnold Shapiro, President of Board of Trustees of Jefferson Community College, thanking him for inviting him and his wife to lunch for President McVean's Inauguration.

did.unittitle: Letter to Albert V. Payne, President of Mohawk Valley Technical Institute, regarding Meeting
did.abstract: Typed letter to Albert V. Payne, President of Mohawk Valley Technical Institute, confirming time and date of meeting at Midtown Plaza.

did.unittitle: Letter to Seymour Eskow, Dean of Mohawk Valley Technical Institute, regarding Appointment as President of Rockland Community College
did.abstract: Typed letter to Seymour Eskow, Dean of Mohawk Valley Technical Institute, congratulating him on his appointment as President of Rockland Community College.

did.unittitle: Letter of Thanks from Seymour Eskow, Dean of Mohawk Valley Technical Institute
did.abstract: Typed letter thanking Almstead for congratulating Eskow on his appointment as President to Rockland Community College.

did.unittitle: Letter to LeRoy V. Good, President of Monroe Community College, regarding Basketball Season Schedule
did.abstract: Typed letter to LeRoy V. Good, President of Monroe Community College, asking if it was possible to schedule home and home games against the newly-formed OCC men's basketball team.

did.unittitle: Letter to Royson N. Whipple, Director of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville regarding Basketball Season Schedule
did.abstract: Typed letter to Royson N. Whipple, Director of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, asking if it were possible to schedule home and home games with the newly formed OCC men's basketball team.

did.unittitle: Letter to Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, regarding Invitation
did.abstract: Typed letter to Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, accepting invitation to dinner.

did.unittitle: Letter from Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, inviting Almstead to Dinner and Concert
did.abstract: Typed letter from Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, inviting Almstead and his wife to dinner and a concert of Billy Butterfield and his orchestra.

did.unittitle: Letter to Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, regarding trip from Morrisville
did.abstract: Typed letter to Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, telling Whipple his trip from Morrisville to Syracuse was uneventful and that he enjoyed the concert.

did.unittitle: Letter to Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, regarding visit to OCC
did.abstract: Typed letter to Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, thanking him for this suggestions for improving Onondaga Community College during his visit to the campus.

did.unittitle: Letter from Royson N. Whipple, President of Agricultural and Technical Institute at Morrisville, regarding Check
Letter from Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, regarding faculty rank
did.abstract: Typed letter from Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, asking what faculty can become "full" professors.

did.unittitle: Letter to Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, regarding Faculty Rank
did.abstract: Typed letter to, Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, telling Block that OCC places no restrictions on the full professor rank and that the College was considering rotating department chairmen.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, regarding copy of Concord
did.abstract: Typed letter to Dr. Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, thanking him for the copy of Concord, a publication from faculty at NYC Community College.

did.unittitle: Letter from Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, regarding Concord publication
did.abstract: Typed letter from Murray H. Block, Acting President of New York City Community College, writing that he is giving Almstead a copy of a NYC Community College faculty publication called, "Concord."

did.unittitle: Letter form Allan Goodwin, of Orange County Community College, regarding Faculty Contract
did.abstract: Typed letter from Allan Goodwin, Chairman of the Professional Problems Committee of the Faculty Association of Orange County Community College, asking for a copy of your standard faculty contract form and statement of academic freedom, tenure, and sabbatical policy.

did.unittitle: Letter from J. Butler Sullivan, Assistant Director of Admissions at SUNY Potsdam, regarding Student Transfers to Four-Year Colleges
did.abstract: Typed letter from J. Butler Sullivan, Assistant Director of Admissions at SUNY Potsdam, regarding a meeting on problems with student transfers from two-year colleges to four-year colleges. Includes summary of guidelines from the meeting held in New York City.

did.unittitle: Letter from J.B. Aidala, Department of Electrical Engineering at Queensborough Community College, regarding Brochure
did.abstract: Typed letter from Professor J.B. Aidala, Chairman of the Dept. of Electrical Engineering at Queensborough Community College, saying he is enclosing a copy of the his department's new brochure. Brochure not with letter. Includes copy form sheets.

did.unittitle: Letter from Joseph D. Santora, Department of Physical Education at Queensborough Community College, regarding State Conference
did.abstract: Typed letter from Joseph D. Santora, Chairman of the Department of Physical Education at Queensborough Community College, thanking Almstead for attending the Junior College Section of a state conference in Syracuse.

did.unittitle: Letter from Seymour Eskow, President of Rockland Community College, regarding Faculty Rank
did.abstract: Typed letter from Seymour Eskow, President of Rockland Community College, asking how OCC determines faculty rank and salary ranges. Includes survey filled out by Glenn WIlliams, OCC Director of Information, that gives information on number of OCC faculty with type of degree and salary information.

did.unittitle: Letter from Seymour Eskow, President of Rockland Community College, regarding Gift to Paul Orvis
did.abstract: Typed letter from Seymour Eskow, President of Rockland Community College, asking for $5 to go towards a gift for Paul Orvis.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. Walter L. Willig, President of Staten Island Community College, regarding Paper on Professional Staff
did.abstract: Typed letter to Dr. Walter L. Willig, President of Staten Island Community College, saying he was sending 3 copies of a paper titled, "Brief Summary of Practices in the Community Colleges Relating to Professional Staff."

did.unittitle: Letter from Dr. Walter L. Willig, President of Staten Island Community College, regarding Paper on Professional Staff
did.abstract: Typed letter from Dr. Walter L. Willig, President of Staten Island Community College, asking for a copy of a paper titled, "Brief Summary of Practices in the Community Colleges Relating the the Professional Staff."

did.unittitle: Letter from Richard F. Grego, Dean of Sullivan County Community College, regarding College Chaplains
did.abstract: Typed letter from Richard F. Grego, Dean of Sullivan County Community College, asking Almstead to complete a questionnaire on college chaplains.

did.unittitle: Letter from Ralph A. Galbraith, Dean of L.C. Smith College of Engineering at Syracuse University, regarding Industrial Engineering Curriculum Meeting
did.abstract: Typed letter from Ralph A. Galbraith, Dean of L.C. Smith College of Engineering at Syracuse University, regarding a conference with community colleges and Syracuse University. Conference was on SU's new industrial engineering curriculum. Included are typed minutes from the conference and list of faculty in the Department of Industrial Engineering at SU.

did.unittitle: Letter from Robert S. McDowell, Assistant to the Dean of L.C. Smith College of Engineering at Syracuse University regarding former OCC Students
did.abstract: Typed letter from Robert S. McDowell, Assistant to the Dean of L.C. Smith College of Engineering at Syracuse University, noting 4 former OCC students now enrolled at Syracuse University's Engineering program.

did.unittitle: Letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding filling Chemistry Technician Position
did.abstract: Typed letter to Phillip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, informing him that OCC was looking for a chemistry technician.

did.unittitle: Letter from Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding Chemistry Technician Position
did.abstract: Typed letter from Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, informing Almstead that Westchester Community College did not have a candidate for the chemistry technician position at OCC and that they were currently looking to fill that position.

did.unittitle: Letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding Invitation to Dedication
did.abstract: Typed letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, congratulating him on the dedication of Westchester Community College's new Physical Education building but he could not attend the dedication.

did.unittitle: Letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding Professional Personnel Committee
did.abstract: Typed letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding report for a committee on Professional Personnel.

did.unittitle: Letter from Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding Professional Personnel Committee
did.abstract: Typed letter from Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding suggestions for meeting of the Professional Personnel Committee. Suggests writing a short review of the Professional Service Law.

did.unittitle: Letter from Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding Finance Law
did.abstract: Typed letter from Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, asking Almstead what his thoughts were about a new Finance Law.

did.unittitle: Letter from Walter E. Rauch, Chairman of Liberal Arts and Business Curriculum at Weschester Community College, regarding Questionnaire
did.abstract: Typed letter from Walter E. Rauch, Chairman of Liberal Arts and Business Curriculum at Weschester Community College, asking if one of his assistants could fill out a questionnaire for a panel titled "Homogeneous Grouping of Students for the Improvement of Teaching Procedures."

did.unittitle: Letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, regarding Finance Law
did.abstract: Typed letter to Philip C. Martin, President of Westchester Community College, responding that OCC was not having an issue with a new Finance Law.

did.unittitle: Letter to Paul B. Orvis, Executive Dean, State University of New York
Letter to John Garfola, Onondaga Community College
Letter to and from Samuel B. Gould, President, State University of New York
Letter from Donald G. Eichmeyer, Assistant Secretary, State University of New York
General Correspondence
did.abstract: Correspondence with various people, state agencies, and organizations.

did.unittitle: Letter from Frank E. Hobson Jr., State Education Department, regarding Visit to Onondaga Community College
did.abstract: Typed letter (with hand-written notations) from Frank E. Hobson Jr., State Education Department, with his recommendations for improvement to OCC after his visit to campus.

did.unittitle: Thank-you Letter to Paul M. Glaude
did.abstract: Typed letter thanking Paul M. Glaude, thanking him for visiting with the foreign languages faculty.

did.unittitle: Thank-you Letter to Congressman R. Walter Riehlman
did.abstract: Typed letter to U.S. Congressman, R. Walter Riehlman, thanking him for his expression of kind thoughts toward the college.

did.unittitle: Letter from Congressman R. Walter Riehlman in Response to Almstead's Thank-You Letter
did.abstract: Typed letter from Congressman R. Walter Riehlman noting that he had received Almstead's thank-you note and that he would like to visit OCC after his campaign is over.

did.unittitle: Memo to George Domohowski Regarding Locks
did.abstract: Typed memo to George Dmohowski asking if it would be a good idea to combine locks so that one key could open multiple doors.

did.unittitle: Letter from J. Cameron Thomson, Chairman of Business Education Committee
did.abstract: Typed letter from J. Cameron Thomson, Chairman of Business Education Committee, informing Almstead that the Trustees of the Committee for Economic Development have issued a policy statement regarding the education of tomorrow's business leaders.

did.unittitle: Letter from S. Avery Raube, National Industrial Conference Board, regarding Fellowships
did.abstract: Typed letter from S. Avery Raube, Vice President of Division of Personnel Administration, National Industrial Conference Board, regarding articles the National Industrial Conference published on company sponsored fellowships for students. Articles are included with letter.

did.unittitle: Correspondence with Onondaga Community College Faculty and Staff
did.abstract: Letters and memos to and from OCC faculty.

did.unittitle: Memo on Closed Circuit Television in Education
did.abstract: Undated typed memo, by Almstead, on how to set up closed circuit TV for educational use (only first page included-pages missing).

did.unittitle: Memo on Faculty Responsibilities and Hours of Work
did.abstract: Typed memo, by Almstead, on faculty duties and hours of work.

did.unittitle: Memo on Staff Luncheon
did.abstract: Typed memo to all staff about having a staff luncheon at Drumlins Country Club.

did.unittitle: Memo on Telephone Usage
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff on telephone use and checking message slips.

did.unittitle: Thank you Letter from George J. Dmohowski
did.abstract: Typed letter from George J. Dmohowski, thanking Almstead, thanking him for being pleasant to work with. Dmohowski also mentions his work helping the School open.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty on Reporting Arrival and Departure
did.abstract: Typed memo asking faculty to report to Mrs. Eells, the receptionist, when they are coming into the building and out of the building so she can handle incoming calls properly.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mrs. McCarty regarding United Nations Week
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mrs. McCarty, asking if she had anything planned for students for United Nations Week.

did.unittitle: Memo from Faculty Academic Committee regarding Organizational Structure
did.abstract: Typed memo from the Academic Committee (Howard Faulkner, Harold Russell, C. Richard Rhoades, George Mulligan, George Dmohowski, Donald Nellenbach) outlining their recommendations for how positions at the College should be organized and structured.

did.unittitle: Memo Regarding Biology Lab Student Assistants
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Oney and Mr. Malek informing them Almstead is allocating $175 for Biology lab student assistants.

did.unittitle: Memo Regarding Chemistry Lab Student Assistants
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Singh informing him that Almstead is allocating $350 for student Chemistry lab assistants.

did.unittitle: Memo Regarding Dental Hygiene Student Assistants
did.abstract: Typed memo to Dr. Russell informing him that Almstead is allocating $175 for student assistants in the Dental Hygiene Lab.

did.unittitle: Memo Regarding Physics Student Assistants
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Mulligan and Mr. Nellenbach, informing them that Almstead is allocating $200 for student assistants in the Physics lab.

did.unittitle: Memo to Dr. Delbalzo Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo to Dr. Delbazo informing him that Almstead is allocating $500 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Faulkner Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supples
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Faulkner informing him that Almstead was allocating $1000 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mrs. Downes and Mr. Singh Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo to to Mrs. Downes and Mr. Singh, informing them that Almstead was allocating $1000 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Rhoades Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo, to Mr. Rhoades, informing him that Almstead was allocating $500 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Nellenbach Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Nellenbach, informing him that Almstead is allocating $3000 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Dr. Russell Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo to Dr. Russell, informing him that Almstead was allocating $1000 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Mulligan Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Mulligan, informing him that Almstead was allocating $3000 for special supplies and expense items for the year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Faltyn Regarding Allocation of Funds for Special Supplies
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Faltyn, informing him that Almstead was allocating $500 from money paid by students for supplies and expense items.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Faltyn Regarding Allocation of Funds for Geology
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Faltyn informing him that Almstead was allocating $500 to be used for special supplies and expense items. Handwriting on memo says "Geology."

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff on Person in Charge While Almstead Absent
did.abstract: Typed memo informing faculty and staff that George Dmohowski would be in charge of the College while Almstead was attending a Regents convocation in Albany.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Faltyn Regarding Geology and Physical Science Student Assistants
did.abstract: Type memo to Mr. Faltyn informing him that Almstead was allocating $200 for student assistants in the Geology and Physical Science labs.

did.unittitle: Memo to Glenn Williams Regarding College Adviser for Student Newspaper
did.abstract: Typed memo to Glenn Williams informing him that Almstead was appointing him as adviser to the student newspaper.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Guidance Counselors Visiting Campus
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty giving information on a visit by guidance counselors to campus.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Student Attitudes
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty asking for them to give a list to Mr. MacDonald of students with "adverse" attitudes in the classroom.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Student Attendance
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty regarding student attendance policy at OCC, specifically what is considered "tardiness" and what is considered an "absence."

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Student Attendance List
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty asking for a list of students who have 3 or more "cuts" to be sent to Mr. MacDonald. Paper torn-possibly incomplete.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Top of Faculty Meetings
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty informing them of the topic of two faculty meetings in December, 1962.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Christmas Party and Faculty Meeting
did.abstract: Typed memo informing faculty that Almstead would like to hold a faculty meeting before a Christmas party, sponsored by Bersani.

did.unittitle: Memo to Miss Davenport and Dr. Delbalzo Regarding Language Laboratory
did.abstract: Typed memo to Miss Davenport and Dr. Delbalzo informing them the language lab was closed until repairs could be made. Damage to lab caused by students.

did.unittitle: Summary of November 1965 Faculty Meeting
Note Regarding Faculty Roles
did.abstract: Typed note listing names of faculty and their roles within the College.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Mid-Year Exams
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty regarding grading policy for mid-year exams.

did.unittitle: Memo to John MacDonald Regarding Dennis E. Sands
did.abstract: Typed memo to John MacDonald, asking him if he could help guide, Dennis E. Sands, an instructor in electrical technology, in learning his duties in his new job.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Minutes of SUNY Board of Trustees Meeting
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty informing them that the SUNY Board of Trustees had resolved that tuition and fees for SUNY community colleges was waived for academic employees.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Shoplifter
did.abstract: Memo to faculty informing them that Almstead was "reasonably sure" that a woman who saw in a hallway was a shoplifter.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Requests for Leave of Absence
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty asking them to fill out a form if they wanted to request a leave of absence. Includes Application for Leave of Absence Form.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Student Evaluations
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty asking them to try evaluating students in "non-academic areas" such as self-discipline, oral expression, resourcefulness, etc.

did.unittitle: Memo to English Department Regarding New Faculty Member
did.abstract: Typed memo to the English Department informing them that R. Wayne Archer has joined the English Department.

did.unittitle: Memo from Howard H. Burtis Regarding Transfer Credit
did.abstract: Typed memo to Almstead, from Howard H. Burtis, informing him that the Board of Trustees was interested to what extent other colleges were accepting credits from OCC, and that Burtis will get information on how many students are requesting transcripts sent to other colleges.

did.unittitle: Memo from C. Richard Rhoades Regarding Almstead Inauguration Ceremony
did.abstract: Typed memo from C. Richard Rhoades, informing faculty and staff that the inauguration ceremony for Almstead that was scheduled for November was being post-poned by the Board of Trustees.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Members Regarding State Education Department Visit
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Burtis, Mr. Larsen, Mr. MacDonald, Mr. Zahm, and Mrs. MacDonald regarding a campus visit from Edward F. Carr, Associate in Higher Education of the State Education Department.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Members Regarding Academic Affairs Council
did.abstract: Typed memo to Professors Bertan, Faltyn, Gammon, Leon, Mr. Gray, and Mr. Weathers informing them that Professor Faltyn will represent the physical science unit on the Academic Affairs Council, replacing Dr. Larsen.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff Regarding Re-Organization of Staff
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff informing them that John Garfola, a Student Personnel Services staff member, would be looking at the functions of the office staff and administrators and propose a plan on how to most efficiently organize staff.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. Krall Regarding Fire Drill
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Krall asking if he could be the contact person for the Fire Marshall for a fire drill.

did.unittitle: Memo to D. Heil, Bookstore Manager, Regarding Purchase of Furniture
did.abstract: Typed memo to D. Heil, the bookstore manager, regarding faculty members purchasing furniture from Penfield Manufacturing Company.

did.unittitle: Announcement Regarding Student Exam
did.abstract: Typed one-paged announcement regarding a test to be administered on Wednesday, Nov. 28.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff Regarding Library Hours
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff on the library hours for the school year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff Regarding Activities with the Switchboard Operator
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff asking them to register all faculty, staff, and student activities with the switchboard operator. Also has information regarding reserving rooms and the college car for activities.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Plan for Solving Problems
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty regarding plan to communicate and solve problems. Includes a diagram of chain of command for who to communicate to when a problem occurs.

did.unittitle: Memo from Richard A. Cobb Regarding Student Closed Circuit TV Presentation
did.abstract: Typed memo to, Almstead and Dean Burtis, from Richard A. Cobb, Coordinator of Television Activities and Audio-Visual Aids, inviting them to watch a presentation from the Television Production Class.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Solutions to Problems
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty on what Offices to contact when dealing with academic problems. Includes explanation of what each Office can help with.

did.unittitle: Memo to Staff Regarding Surveys and Questionnaires
did.abstract: Typed memo to Staff informing them to send completed surveys and questionnaires to the Office of the Director of Information.

did.unittitle: Memo to Mr. DeBlasis Regarding Proposed Television Production
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. DeBlasis asking if his drama group would be interested in writing and producing a play about life at OCC. Almstead expresses desire to film the production for future use.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff Regarding Student Personnel Services Assignments
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff informing them of changes in assignments and responsibilities within the Student Personnel Services Office, specifically referring to Dean MacDonald and Mr. Garfola.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Members Regarding Meeting on Admission Policy
did.abstract: Typed memo to Deans Burtis, Larsen, MacDonald, and Flansburg, Garfola, Henderson, Russell informing them of a meeting to be held for developing a plan for admission policy.

did.unittitle: Letter from Philip G. Klein Regarding Payroll Deductions
did.abstract: Typed letter from Philip G. Klein, Faculty Co-Secretary, requesting Almstead to have payroll deductions be shown in written form on faculty paychecks.

did.unittitle: Memo to Ransom G. MacKenzie Regarding Vocational and Technical Training and Facilities
did.abstract: Typed memo to Ransom G. MacKenzie, summarizing a meeting about where to have vocational and technical training facilities and if community college program in vocational and technical training could succeed in the area.

did.unittitle: Memo to Richard Cobb Regarding Public Address System
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Cobb asking Cobb to submit a report on changes and procedures involved for re-locating the public address system. Includes Cobb's request to move the public address system from the audio visual room to the telephone switchboard room.

did.unittitle: Memo to Robert Malek Regarding Medical Laboratory Technicians
did.abstract: Typed memo to Robert Malek on some of Malek's students becoming medical laboratory technicians at Upstate Medical.

did.unittitle: Memo to Howard Faulkner Regarding Meeting with New York State Industrial Arts Teachers
did.abstract: Typed memo to Howard Faulkner approving of a meeting with the New York State Industrial Arts teachers.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Members Regarding Pharmaceutical Curriculum
did.abstract: Typed memo to Deans Burtis and Larsen, Mrs. Swerdlow, and Dr. Russell, asking them to attend a meeting with Dean Leverman of Columbia University about the possibility of creating a pharmaceutical curriculum.

did.unittitle: Memo to Howard Faulkner Regarding Commencement Speaker
did.abstract: Typed memo to Howard Faulkner, informing him that Senator Carl Curtis accepted the invitation to speak at Commencement.

did.unittitle: Announcement Regarding President of SUNY
did.abstract: Typed announcement from Almstead that Samuel B. Gould would be President of the State University of New York starting September 1, 1964.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff on Policy for Identifying Candidates for Graduation
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff asking for their reactions to the Policy and Procedures for Identifying Candidates for Graduation.

did.unittitle: Memo to Professor Archer Regarding Summer Employment
did.abstract: Typed memo to Professor Archer informing him that, due to there being less in the "honey bucket," there would be 7 weeks, not 10 weeks, of summer employment.

did.unittitle: William G. Dwyer Speech, "Behind the Door"
did.abstract: Typed copy of William G. Dwyer's speech, "Behind the Door" from a Community College Workshop at SUNY Farmingdale.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff Regarding Change of Assignments and Appointments
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff regarding John MacDonald taking over the General Studies Program and John M. Parker joining the College as Dean of Student Personnel Services. Includes brief C.V. of Parker.

did.unittitle: Memo to J.H. Mullaley Regarding Two New Hires
did.abstract: Typed memo to J.H. Mullaley, informing him of two new hires, Mrs. Arrain and Mr. Bedell.

did.unittitle: Letter to Dr. Daniel Burdick Regarding Meeting to Discuss Nursing and Medical Laboratory Technology Programs
did.abstract: Typed letter to Dr. Daniel Burdick asking to arrange a meeting to discuss how Burdick could assist with formulating Nursing and Medical Laboratory Technology programs.

did.unittitle: Letter ffom Professor John T. Henderson Regarding Gramercy Guild Group Graphics Award
did.abstract: Letter Professor John T. Henderson, Electrical-Mechanical Technology gave to Almstead about an Award given to a company out of Colorado to students showing achievement in a graphics course. Includes letter received from Gramercy Guild Group-sponsor of the award.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Members Regarding Appointment of Dean of the College
did.abstract: Typed memo to Mr. Murray, Mr. Flansburg, and Dean Parker informing them that Howard H. Burtis was appointed Dean of the College, effective Sept. 3, 1964.

did.unittitle: Memo from Dean Larsen Regarding Federal Funds
did.abstract: Typed memo from Dean Larsen asking Almstead asking for clarification on how the college can obtain federal funds.

did.unittitle: Memos Regarding NYSTA Meeting at OCC
did.abstract: Typed memos between Howard Faulkner and Almstead about a meeting at OCC with the Industrial Arts Division of the NYSTA.

did.unittitle: Memo to Dean of Women Regarding Student Residency at the Mizpah Hotel
did.abstract: Typed memo to the Dean of Women stating that Miss Rice and Miss Regan can stay at the Mizpah Hotel while being students.

did.unittitle: Memo to R. Wayne Archer Regarding Nassau Community College Staff Publication
did.abstract: Memo to R. Wayne Archer stating he was attaching a staff publication from Nassau Community College (not included with memo). Asks Archer's thoughts on OCC Faculty having their own publication.

did.unittitle: Memo to Professor Rhoades Regarding Recording of Student Choir
did.abstract: Typed memo to Professor Rhoades asking for a recording of the choir for two talks.

did.unittitle: Memo to Dean John Parker Regarding List of 1964 Graduates
did.abstract: Memo to Dean John Parker asking for a list of the 1964 graduates.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Presenting Faculty Constitution to Board of Trustees
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty stating that he had sent the faculty constitution to members of the Board of Trustees. States his support of the faculty.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty and Staff Regarding Holiday Party
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty and staff informing them that he would miss the holiday party due to a meeting with SUNY President Gould.

did.unittitle: Memo to Nancy K. McCarty Regarding Mimeographed Materials
did.abstract: Typed memo to Nancy K. McCarty asking her to review materials to be mimeographed to see if the materials are suitable for classroom use.

did.unittitle: Memo from Nancy K. McCarty Regarding Mimeographed Materials
did.abstract: Typed memo from Nancy K. McCarty informing Almstead that the stencils had already been mimeographed.

did.unittitle: Memo from John Henderson Regarding Participation in Federal Programs
did.abstract: Typed memo from John Henderson stating that in order to participate in federal programs such as the Economic Opportunity Act, the College would need to hire an additional secretary to handle the record keeping. Advises a transfer of funds from the capital category to personnel services in order to hire a secretary.

did.unittitle: Memo to Department Chairmen Regarding Meeting with Board of Trustees
did.abstract: Typed memo to the Department Chairmen, asking if they will meet with the Board of Trustees.

did.unittitle: Memo to George Dmohowski Regarding Board of Trustees Meeting Invitation
did.abstract: Typed memo to George Dmohowski stating he mistakenly included him in an invitation to meet with the Board of Trustees and that it was unnecessary for Dmohowski to attend. Attached is a hand-written note from Glenn Williams to Almstead that states he will be at the Board of Trustees meeting at Marine Midland Bank.

did.unittitle: Letter from John Henderson to John Leonard Regarding Visit to Mutual of New York
did.abstract: Typed copy of letter by John Henderson, Chairman of Technological Department to John Leonard, Vice-President of Personnel of Mutual of New York regarding a visit to Mutual of New York. Visit was to gain insight into what training is needed for Mutual of New York Staff.

did.unittitle: Memo to Alvin G. Mardon Regarding Comparison of 1962 and 1965 Academic Year
did.abstract: Typed memo to Alvin G. Mardon, fulfilling Mardon's request for a comparison of the number of faculty, investment, and budget projections of the 1962 and 1965 year.

did.unittitle: Memo to Office Staff Regarding Columbus Day
did.abstract: Typed memo to Office Staff suggesting that the College observe Columbus Day on the Friday after Thanksgiving as Columbus Day falls during the middle of the term.

did.unittitle: Memo from William F. Krall Regarding Dennis Sands
did.abstract: Typed memo from William F. Krall giving a review of instructor Dennis Sands. Recommends promoting him to Assistant Professor.

did.unittitle: Memo to Faculty Regarding Meeting on Personnel Policies
did.abstract: Typed memo to faculty stating that a scheduled meeting would be for teaching faculty only and the topic would be personnel policies.

Dr. Almstead's obituary
Office of Dr. Karl D. Larsen, Acting President (January 1966 to June 1966)
did.abstract: Archival material related to the Acting Presidency of Dr. Karl D. Larsen. Dr. Larsen received his B.A. and M.A. from the University of Maine, and his Ph. D. from the Penn State University. Prior to coming to Onondaga Community College Dr. Larsen was an instructor at the University of Maine, Layfayette College, Stevens Institute, and served in the U.S. military. In 1963 Dr. Larsen became the Dean of Faculty and Professor of Physics at Onondaga Community College. He became acting President of OCC in 1966, serving in this capacity from January through June. Dr. Larsen went on to teach at the University of Bridgeport. Dr. Larsen was an author of many research papers, and served as a consultant in the field of Forensic Physics. Dr. Larsen died in 1990 in Bridgeport, Connecticut.

did.unittitle: Coorespondence
Memorandum to Board of Trustees and Committees
Newspaper Clippings
did.abstract: Contains Dr. Larsen's obituary

did.unittitle: Office of Dr. Marvin A. Rapp (June 1966 - Aug. 1973)
did.abstract: Archival material related to the Presidency of Dr. Marvin A. Rapp. B.A. from Colgate University, Magna Cum Laude and Phi Beta Kappa; Masterâ€™s and Ph.D. from Duke University; U. S. Army Air Corps Intelligence (World War II); Vice President and Executive Dean of Nassau Community College, Mitchell Field, Long Island, NY 1961 to 1966. After OCC, Dr. Rapp was appointed Special Assistant to the Council on County Colleges in Trenton, NJ; continued his publications on the history of New York State with a particular interest in the Erie Canal and in Ontario County; served on the Board of Trustees for Finger Lakes Community College; and received the New York State Outstanding Community College.

Obituary and Biography of Dr. Rapp
Office of Interim President Dr. Roy Price
did.abstract: Archival material related to the Interim Presidency of Dr. Roy Price. Dr. Price served as President of Onondaga Community College from 1973 to 1975. Dr. Price received a B.A. in Philosophy from University of Chicago; Ed.M. and Ed.D. from Harvard; retired as Chair of Doctoral Programs in Social Science at Syracuse University. After serving as Interim President, he continued at OCC as a consultant. Price died May 25, 1992, in DeWitt, NY.
